@bcoe - thanks for the approval. Did you see my question on whether we should keep the link to the splash page?
@vkoves I'm with you, let's remove the splash page; it was good for the hackathon, but I don't think we need it going forward.

##### 💛  - [Coveralls](https://coveralls.io)
@bcoe - removed the splash page section. Take a look, and see if it looks all good.

@bcoe - this example works great, but should we also tell folks to run `nyc report` (or `nyc report --reporter=html`) to create a coverage report in their coverage folder? It might just be me (since I don't use NYC) but I wasn't sure what to do with the output JSON so the result doesn't necessarily look impressive, and might be confusing to folks who just use Istanbul "out of the box".
@vkoves looks good to me, go ahead and land. I made some updates to the actual example if you don’t mind eyeballing them.
@bcoe - merging! I commented on PR #12 as well
@rjaltman this sounds like a good idea to me, want to take a stab at adding some additional content to the README?

Great suggestions! I don't think I'll be able to take this on myself in the near future, but I've labelled it to hopefully allow it to get some attention
Your request definitely makes sense. I've marked this as a bug and indicated that we would love contribution on resolving this issue
Cool. Let me have a go at it.

##### 💛  - [Coveralls](https://coveralls.io)
@bcoe - can you take on reviewing this PR? What are your thoughts on whether we should change all behavior or just paths with http protocols?
@vkoves I will happily review this PR; I'm currently on a trip to Lisbon, but hope to put in a bit of open-source work throughout the weekend.

Hi @vkoves and @bcoe, any time frame to get feedback on this?
Don't mean to push but I also have a few ideas for the fixtures generation (extend for es6 modules cases and make it idempotent by removing path parts relative to each dev machine. Also, the docs seem to be outdated) and some guidance would be appreciated.
@hfcg-hcf @vkoves I apologize, was on vacation and then upon returning have been at a week-long all hands for npm, Inc ... I will make an effort to do some OSS this weekend.
Hm, I know very little about this. @bcoe - does Istanbul natively handle source maps? Is there a way we could do this?
